0: And something to like about the hotel is no outside visitor can to the gardens which gives it the exclusiveness Service was great and accommodating with 24 hours butler at your service breakfast was very good as well at the tiffin room with ala carte choice along with buffet spread we were spoilt for choices
Staff arranged for us to leave our luggage there after check out and provided a shower facility prior to our transfer to the airport
The suite has high ceilings and separated in 3 distinct areas dining living room bedroom and bathroom
Raffles oozes cool classical colonial charm with its lovely long veranda walkways elegant high ceilings and beautifully preserved elevators
We ate in the Long Bar and the Courtyard Cafe
The room was huge with beautiful high ceilings and is divided with seating area dining area when you first enter
The level of comfort and beautiful garden setting are outstanding I had a Courtyard Suite
The hotel is beautiful and the suite we had was short of amazing
We took the Courtyard Suite a door away from the Pablo Neruda Suite
1: The suites of Raffles now still keeps the British Colonial style the shutter windows in the sitting room golden brass taps of the bath room everything of the room reminds me Raffles is the hotel of 19th century of the word

So special in fact that we changed our return hotel at the last minute for Raffles again on the 9th of July 2017 upgrading to the Sir Stamford Raffles Suites one of two Presidential Suites and did not want to leave
From the first welcome at the door through reception check in and introduction to our room this was an experience like no other
they even prepared a cake and decorated the room
We went for Singapore Sling which was in the billiard room
We visited the billiards room for a tourist trip for a Singapore sling

We knew beforehand that the Hotel would be partly closed during our visit but in no way did this spoil anything in fact we felt really at home in the Courtyard Suite and loved its cosy comfort traditional decor fittings etc
My biggest disapointment was when I arrived at my room
Room was Personality room named after Radyard Kipling and was so theamed
2: et dépasé il vous sera nécesaire de demander les plus historiques ou la suite Présidentiele dun rare rafinement

Butler Jeremy was efficient at delivering fresh milk for coffee in suite it must be the first hotel I have stayed in where no milk or creamer is provided in room of course preferable would be on call tea or coffee served by butler as used to be the case in Raffles and is still done at The Strand Hotel Rangoon for example
The lighting in the room was grossly inadequate
The floors and furniture are dark wood and the walls are a warm white The bathroom is clad entirely in carara marble with a lot of nicely milled detailed
But the suite will only be ready for you after 9 pm ”

As there were no other Personality suites available we both chose to change rooms and downgrade to a lower room category the Front desk Manager offered us some small financial compensation each to cover the difference

Our regular spot was the Long Room for many years there was an excellent band called Modique but there was no band no music and very much a dumbed down experience Sadly this visit was extreme disappointing
Quality oozed out of every fitting and piece of furniture or soft furnishing
The water bottles that are available for guests were n’t stored in the fridge both still sparkling
Our suite consisted of a parlor a bedroom and a bathroom
